revised_title: Investigating the Influence of River Thames on London's Temperature and Fog
tldr: This article examines the impact of the River Thames on temperature and fog in London. The author compares temperature readings from various locations, including the Royal Society, Royal Observatory, and other sites, to understand the influence of the river on local climate. The findings suggest that the proximity of the river causes higher winter temperatures and lower summer temperatures, contributing to the formation of London fogs.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Climate and Meteorology
